At 06:45 12/10/2005, you wrote:
>Ian, in my experience almost every conference does expect you to
>attend if you submitted a paper and it was accepted.  That is
>something to be aware of since it will look really bad if you
>knowingly got into a conference with no intention of showing up.  If
>that causes problems for you, you may want to consider the journal
>option.

Damn!  I half suspected that, but was ignoring it :)

I never was great one for attending conderences, even when I wasn't 
going to have to pay the costs myself (getting invited to speak is 
somehow different, I did a fair bit of that as part of liaiaiaiaising 
with academia when I was in game R&D).

Have these people never noticed the Internet and how you generally 
never need to leave you armchair for anything short of reproduction 
these days.  Actually, given the choice, I _would_ leave the 
armchair, I'd take the PC out onto the moors, but have you tried 
finding a broadband network connection half-way up a millstone 
tor?  One day though....

Of course, the simplest solution for me would be if I had a 
collaborator who was in academia.  Maybe my friend at the U of 
Sheffield would be interested, I'll ask him....

Ian



In fifteen minutes, everybody will be in the future.
